subject: Self Care
title: Alcohol and Sleep Quality
description: A fast breakdown of Alcohol and Sleep Quality for builders.

hook.text: A glass of wine makes you drowsy. But the sleep that follows is fragmented, shallow, and unrestorative.

buildup.text: Alcohol is a sedative. Sedation looks like sleep on the outside, but the brain is not truly sleeping.

discovery.text: Alcohol suppresses REM sleep dramatically. Without REM, emotional processing and memory suffer.

twist.text: As alcohol metabolizes overnight, the body rebounds with micro-awakenings you often don't remember.

climax.text: Even moderate drinking close to bedtime fragments sleep architecture for the entire night ahead.

punchline.text: Alcohol sedates you. It does not let you sleep.

quiz.question: How does alcohol affect REM sleep?
options: It has no effect on REM
